definitions.definition: to tell the public about a product or a service in order to encourage people to buy or to use it

examples.text: If you want to attract customers you need to advertise.
to advertise on TV/online/on social media
a glossy brochure advertising holidays in the Maldives
How to Advertise a Business for Free on the Internet
I bought the camera and case as advertised in the catalogue.
The cruise was advertised as the ‘journey of a lifetime’.
These products have been advertised very heavily.
financial advisers advertising their services in the press
If you aren't advertising this service already, it's something to consider.

definitions.definition: to let people know that something is going to happen, or that a job is available by giving details about it in a newspaper, on a notice in a public place, on the internet, etc.

examples.text: We are currently advertising for a new sales manager.
The best jobs are not always advertised in newspapers.
Vacancies are usually advertised on our website.
We advertised the concert quite widely.
We are advertising for a babysitter.
There are plans to advertise the job nationally.

definitions.definition: to show or tell something about yourself to other people

examples.text: I wouldn't advertise the fact that you don't have a work permit.
She coughed to advertise her presence.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French advertiss-, lengthened stem of advertir, from Latin advertere ‘turn towards’, from ad- ‘to’ + vertere ‘to turn’.The original sense was ‘turn one's attention to’, later ‘bring to someone's attention’.
